content.label: Health & Safety - Your Toddler’s Health and Safety - 14 Months
content.value: Health & Safety

content.label: Health & Safety - Your Toddler’s Health and Safety - 14 Months
content.value:
• As your toddler becomes more mobile, it’s important to hold her hand and keep an eye on her, particularly when you’re out and about together.

  • For example, don’t let her dart away from you in the grocery store, and be particularly vigilant when you’re near cars, such as on the street or in a parking lot. Be very careful anywhere around water, too.

  • Because your little one can wander off in an instant, the best strategy is to hold her hand. If she tries to wriggle free, you can say something like “I know you want to look over there, but I need to hold your hand to make sure you’re safe.”

  • You might also like to install extra locks to doors and gates, as well as baby gates or even alarms, to ensure your toddler can’t get out of the house without your knowledge. It’s especially important that the pool and driveway are inaccessible to your 14-month-old.

  • Although many new cars come with a rear visibility system or an alarm that can detect movement behind the car, always double check that your toddler is not behind you as you back out of the driveway.

  • When it comes to car safety, be sure keep your car locked at all times, even when it’s in the garage. This helps prevent your toddler getting into the car and accidentally setting it in gear, or becoming trapped in the car and developing heatstroke.
content.translateValue:
• Etter hvert som smårollingen din blir mer mobil, er det viktig å holde henne i hånden og følge med på henne, spesielt når dere er ute sammen.

  • For eksempel, ikke la henne løpe fra deg i matbutikken, og vær spesielt oppmerksom når dere er i nærheten av biler, som på gaten eller i en parkeringsplass. Vær også veldig forsiktig i nærheten av vann.

  • Fordi den lille kan forsvinne på et øyeblikk, er den beste strategien å holde henne i hånden. Hvis hun prøver å vri seg løs, kan du si noe som "Jeg vet at du vil se der borte, men jeg må holde deg i hånden for å være sikker på at du er trygg."

  • Du kan også vurdere å installere ekstra låser på dører og porter, samt barnesikringer eller til og med alarmer, for å sikre at smårollingen ikke kommer seg ut av huset uten at du vet det. Det er spesielt viktig at bassenget og oppkjørselen er utilgjengelige for din 14 måneder gamle baby.

  • Selv om mange nye biler har et system for bakoversikt eller en alarm som kan oppdage bevegelse bak bilen, må du alltid dobbeltsjekke at smårollingen din ikke er bak deg når du rygger ut av oppkjørselen.

  • Når det gjelder bilsikkerhet, sørg for å holde bilen låst til enhver tid, selv når den står i garasjen. Dette hjelper med å forhindre at småbarnet ditt kommer inn i bilen og ved et uhell setter den i gir, eller blir fanget i bilen og får heteslag.

content.value: Etter hvert som smårollingen din blir mer mobil, er det viktig å holde henne i hånden og følge med på henne, spesielt når dere er ute sammen.

For eksempel, ikke la henne løpe fra deg i matbutikken, og vær spesielt oppmerksom når dere er i nærheten av biler, som på gaten eller i en parkeringsplass. Vær også veldig forsiktig i nærheten av vann.

Fordi den lille kan forsvinne på et øyeblikk, er den beste strategien å holde henne i hånden. Hvis hun prøver å vri seg løs, kan du si noe som "Jeg vet at du vil se der borte, men jeg må holde deg i hånden for å være sikker på at du er trygg."

Du kan også vurdere å installere ekstra låser på dører og porter, samt barnesikringer eller til og med alarmer, for å sikre at smårollingen ikke kommer seg ut av huset uten at du vet det. Det er spesielt viktig at bassenget og oppkjørselen er utilgjengelige for din 14 måneder gamle baby.

Selv om mange nye biler har et system for bakoversikt eller en alarm som kan oppdage bevegelse bak bilen, må du alltid dobbeltsjekke at smårollingen din ikke er bak deg når du rygger ut av oppkjørselen.

Når det gjelder bilsikkerhet, sørg for å holde bilen låst til enhver tid, selv når den står i garasjen. Dette hjelper med å forhindre at småbarnet ditt kommer inn i bilen og ved et uhell setter den i gir, eller blir fanget i bilen og får heteslag.

content.label: Life as a Parent - Your Life as a Parent: Sibling Dynamics - 14 Months
content.value: Life as a Parent

content.label: Life as a Parent - Your Life as a Parent: Sibling Dynamics - 14 Months
content.value:
If you have older children, you may notice a slight change in the dynamic now that your littlest one is a toddler. As we’ve described, your toddler is the center of her own universe, and this can make her behave in ways that your older children may find annoying.

For example, your 14-month-old might infringe on her siblings' privacy, take their things as her own, and throw a tantrum if they take their things back.

On the other hand, your older children may be jealous that your 14-month-old gets more of your attention.

Depending on the age of your older child, you may find she is doing things, like misbehaving, just to get your attention.

The sibling rivalry should diminish in the years to come as your children need less of your focused attention.

In the meantime, make an effort to spend some quality time with each of your children. Perhaps have your partner, family member, or babysitter mind one while you enjoy some one-on-one time or a fun outing with the other, and vice versa.

content.translateValue:
Hvis du har eldre barn, kan du merke en liten endring i dynamikken nå som din minste er blitt en smårolling. Som vi har beskrevet, er smårollingen midtpunktet i sin egen verden, og dette kan få henne til å oppføre seg på måter som dine eldre barn kan finne irriterende.

For eksempel kan din 14 måneder gamle datter krenke søsknenes privatliv, ta tingene deres som sine egne og kaste et raserianfall hvis de tar tilbake tingene sine.

På den annen side kan de eldre barna dine være sjalu fordi 14-måneders-babyen får mer av oppmerksomheten din.

Avhengig av alderen til det eldste barnet ditt, kan du oppdage at hun gjør ting, som å oppføre seg dårlig, bare for å få oppmerksomheten din.

Søskenrivaliseringen bør avta i årene som kommer ettersom barna dine trenger mindre av din fokuserte oppmerksomhet.

I mellomtiden kan du prøve å tilbringe litt kvalitetstid med hvert av barna dine. Kanskje kan partneren din, et familiemedlem eller en barnevakt passe på det ene mens du nyter litt alenetid eller en morsom utflukt med det andre, og omvendt.

content.label: 14 Months Old
content.value: Introduction

content.label: 14 Months Old
content.value:
At 14 months old, your toddler may be revealing more and more of his personality. For example, you may find he understands more of what you say, and that he may be determined to keep going with a favorite activity even when it's time for bed.

There’s a lot you can do to support your toddler’s happy and healthy development, and to help him feel safe and secure while he explores his world in more independent ways. Read on to find out how you can navigate issues like separation anxiety and sibling dynamics at this time.

We also outline some development milestones your 14-month-old may reach around this time, and offer some tips on mealtimes and sleep that you may find helpful. Life is full with a toddler in the house, and this month is no exception. Let’s dive right in.
content.translateValue:
Når barnet ditt er 14 måneder gammelt, kan det være at personligheten hans kommer mer og mer frem. For eksempel kan du oppdage at han forstår mer av hva du sier, og at han kan være bestemt på å fortsette med en favorittaktivitet selv når det er sengetid.

Det er mye du kan gjøre for å støtte ditt barns glade og sunne utvikling, og for å hjelpe ham med å føle seg trygg og sikker mens han utforsker verden på mer selvstendige måter. Les videre for å finne ut hvordan du kan håndtere problemer som separasjonsangst og søskenforhold i denne perioden.

Vi beskriver også noen utviklingsmilepæler som barnet ditt på 14 måneder kan nå rundt denne tiden, og gir noen tips om måltider og søvn som du kanskje vil finne nyttige. Livet er fullt med en smårolling i huset, og denne måneden er intet unntak. La oss dykke rett inn.

content.label: Feeding - Mealtimes and Menus for Your 14-Month-Old
content.value: Feeding

content.label: Feeding - Mealtimes and Menus for Your 14-Month-Old
content.value:
Your toddler will need about 1,000 calories worth of food a day — about three small meals and two hearty snacks — to keep her healthy and energized. Offer nutritious selections from the main food groups: protein foods like meat and eggs, dairy products like cow’s milk and cheese, fruits and vegetables, and wholegrain cereals, pasta, or bread.

Although a varied diet of healthy foods usually provides enough vitamins and minerals for most children, some children may need supplements.

For example, your little one may need supplements of vitamins B2, B12, and calcium if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. If she drinks lots of cow’s milk (much more than about 24 to 32 ounces a day) she may need an iron supplement. Your healthcare provider will be able to recommend any needed supplements.
content.translateValue:
Småbarnet ditt vil trenge omtrent 1 000 kalorier verdt av mat om dagen – omtrent tre små måltider og to solide snacks – for å holde henne sunn og energisk. Tilby næringsrike valg fra hovedmatgruppene: proteinrike matvarer som kjøtt og egg, meieriprodukter som kumelk og ost, frukt og grønnsaker, og fullkorn som korn, pasta eller brød.

Selv om et variert kosthold med sunne matvarer vanligvis gir nok vitaminer og mineraler for de fleste barn, kan noen barn trenge kosttilskudd.

For eksempel kan det hende at den lille trenger tilskudd av vitaminene B2, B12 og kalsium hvis familien din følger et strengt vegetariansk kosthold. Hvis hun drikker mye kumelk (mye mer enn rundt 24 til 32 unser om dagen), kan hun trenge et jerntilskudd. Helsesøsteren din vil kunne anbefale nødvendige tilskudd.

content.label: Sleep - 14-Month-Old Toddler Sleep Schedule
content.value: Sleep

content.label: Sleep - 14-Month-Old Toddler Sleep Schedule
content.value:
Your 14-month-old probably needs about 12 to 14 hours of sleep a day. At this stage she may be down to a single daily nap, as about half of all toddlers are by 15 months.

If your toddler has recently started walking, you might find that she has a hard time winding down at naptime or bedtime, given the excitement of exploring the world on two feet. You may find her walking back and forth in her crib as she practices this new skill.

This is OK; your toddler’s excited about her newfound mobility. Watch for signs of crabbiness and let her sleep then as opposed to following the sleep schedule that may have worked until recently. Adjusting to a new routine will happen over time and it will become easier for your child to settle.

If she is still fighting naps, or bedtime is a real struggle, check out the Smart Sleep Coach by Pampers App, which combines step-by-step sleep coaching with in-app tracking tools that will help you get her sleep on track.
content.translateValue:
Din 14 måneder gamle trenger antagelig rundt 12 til 14 timer søvn om dagen. På dette stadiet kan hun være nede i en enkelt daglig lur, slik som rundt halvparten av alle småbarn er ved 15 måneder.

Hvis smårollingen din nylig har begynt å gå, kan det hende at hun har vanskelig for å roe seg ned ved lur- eller leggetid, gitt spenningen ved å utforske verden på to bein. Du kan oppdage at hun går frem og tilbake i sengen sin mens hun øver på denne nye ferdigheten.

Dette er greit; smårollingen din er begeistret for sin nyvunne mobilitet. Se etter tegn på irritabilitet og la henne sove når hun trenger det, i stedet for å følge søvnplanen som kanskje har fungert inntil nylig. Å tilpasse seg en ny rutine vil skje over tid, og det vil bli lettere for barnet ditt å finne ro.

Hvis hun fortsatt kjemper mot lurene, eller leggetid er en skikkelig kamp, sjekk utSmart Sleep Coach by Pampers App, som kombinerer trinn-for-trinn søvnveiledning med sporingsverktøy i appen som vil hjelpe deg med å få søvnen hennes på rett spor.

content.value: Din 14 måneder gamle trenger antagelig rundt 12 til 14 timer søvn om dagen. På dette stadiet kan hun være nede i en enkelt daglig lur, slik som rundt halvparten av alle småbarn er ved 15 måneder.

Hvis smårollingen din nylig har begynt å gå, kan det hende at hun har vanskelig for å roe seg ned ved lur- eller leggetid, gitt spenningen ved å utforske verden på to bein. Du kan oppdage at hun går frem og tilbake i sengen sin mens hun øver på denne nye ferdigheten.

Dette er greit; smårollingen din er begeistret for sin nyvunne mobilitet. Se etter tegn på irritabilitet og la henne sove når hun trenger det, i stedet for å følge søvnplanen som kanskje har fungert inntil nylig. Å tilpasse seg en ny rutine vil skje over tid, og det vil bli lettere for barnet ditt å finne ro.
Hvis hun fortsatt kjemper mot lurene, eller leggetid er en skikkelig kamp, sjekk ut
Smart Sleep Coach by Pampers App
, som kombinerer trinn-for-trinn søvnveiledning med sporingsverktøy i appen som vil hjelpe deg med å få søvnen hennes på rett spor.

content.label: Development Support - How to Support Your Baby’s Development - 3 Months
content.value: Development Support

content.label: Development Support - How to Support Your Baby’s Development - 3 Months
content.value:
Your pediatrician will share a variety of ways you can help foster your baby's development. Many of these suggested activities will encourage movement and help your baby master the skills she will need to roll, sit, and hold her head up, while others will promote cognitive and sensory development.

Here are some strategies to keep in mind, along with some 3-month-old baby activities to try:

  • Strengthen back and neck muscles. With you close by, place your baby on her stomach on a play mat or blanket for short stretches of tummy time to gain more control over her legs, arms, and head.

  • Promote hand-eye coordination. Encourage your baby to grasp for small objects like toys or your fingers. She'll need this skill as she learns to bring her hands to her mouth successfully.

  • Aid visual development. Her distance vision, color vision, and tracking skills are all improving during this month. Help her along by introducing stimulating colors, patterns, and textures for her to enjoy in the form of toys, books, colorful mobiles, play mats, and other activities.

Learn more about the stages of early childhood development in Parent Life.
content.translateValue:
Din barnelege vil dele en rekke måter du kan bidra til å fremme babyens utvikling. Mange av disse foreslåtte aktivitetene vil oppmuntre til bevegelse og hjelpe babyen din med å mestre ferdighetene hun trenger for å rulle, sitte og holde hodet oppe, mens andre vil fremme kognitiv og sensorisk utvikling.

Her er noen strategier å huske på, sammen med noen aktiviteter for en 3 måneder gammel baby som du kan prøve:

  • Styrk rygg- og nakkemuskler.Med deg i nærheten, legg babyen din på magen på en lekematte eller et teppe for korte perioder med magetid for å få bedre kontroll over ben, armer og hode.

  • Fremme hånd-øye-koordinasjon.Oppmuntre babyen din til å gripe etter små gjenstander som leker eller fingrene dine. Hun vil trenge denne ferdigheten når hun lærer å føre hendene til munnen.

  • Støtt visuell utvikling.Synet hennes på avstand, fargesynet og evnen til å følge bevegelser blir bedre denne måneden. Hjelp henne ved å introdusere stimulerende farger, mønstre og teksturer som hun kan glede seg over i form av leker, bøker, fargerike uroer, lekematter og andre aktiviteter.

Lær mer omstages of early childhood developmenti Foreldrelivet.

content.label: Daily Schedule - A Day in the Life of Your Toddler - 14 months
content.value: Daily Schedule

content.label: Daily Schedule - A Day in the Life of Your Toddler - 14 months
content.value:
Life with a 14-month-old is never dull. Here’s what a typical day might include at your house:

Sleeping

  • Between 12 and 14 hours of sleep per day

  • One or two naps a day

  • Being excited about walking may disrupt the sleep schedule

Eating

  • Your toddler needs about 1,000 calories a day

  • Offer a wide range of healthy food

  • Serve healthy snacks instead of sugary treats

  • Ask your child's healthcare provider about supplements

Developmental Activities

  • Have "conversations" with your toddler

  • Name objects and body parts to help your child learn the words

  • Encourage playing with objects that develop fine motor skills like blocks and soft toys

  • Give your toddler lots of opportunities to move, crawl, and walk

  • Let your child self-feed using unbreakable spoon, bowl, and cup

You work to be prepared for each day, but sometimes routines get disrupted. Find out how these disruptions impact your little one and what you can do when they happen.
content.translateValue:
Livet med en 14 måneder gammel baby er aldri kjedelig. Her er hva en typisk dag kan inneholde hos dere:

Soving

  • Mellom 12 og 14 timer søvn per dag

  • En eller to lurer om dagen

  • Å være spent på å gå kan forstyrre søvnplanen

Spising

  • Barnet ditt trenger omtrent 1 000 kalorier om dagen

  • Tilby et bredt utvalg av sunn mat

  • Server sunne snacks i stedet for sukkerholdige godbiter

  • Spør helsepersonell om kosttilskudd for barnet ditt

Utviklingsaktiviteter

  • Ha "samtaler" med smårollingen din

  • Navngi gjenstander og kroppsdeler for å hjelpe barnet ditt med å lære ordene

  • Oppmuntre til lek med gjenstander som utvikler finmotorikk, som klosser og myke leker

  • Gi smårollingen din mange muligheter til å bevege seg, krabbe og gå

  • La barnet ditt spise selv med uknuselig skje, bolle og kopp

Du jobber for å være forberedt på hver dag, men noen gangerroutines get disrupted.Finn ut hvordan disse forstyrrelsene påvirker den lille og hva du kan gjøre når de skjer.

content.label: Development Support - How to Support Your 14-Month-Old’s Development
content.value: Development Support

content.label: Development Support - How to Support Your 14-Month-Old’s Development
content.value:
These are just some of the things you can do to support your 14-month-old’s development:

  • Involve him in routine tasks. Toddlers love to imitate and be included in family life, so let your little help you with simple jobs around the home. For example, put some music on and work together to put his toys into his toy basket. The aim is to make this task fun and not a chore, so give him lots of time, help him do a good job, and praise him for helping out. Another idea could be to encourage him to help you put the milk away in a low shelf of the fridge. Giving him a dustpan and brush to “sweep” with is another option. He’ll feel proud that he gets to help with “big boy” jobs. Plus, helping is an important social skill that your toddler will need to slowly learn.

  • Encourage social interactions. You may find that your 14-month-old enjoys being with other children, especially those who are a little older. Most likely he will play by himself alongside another child, which is called parallel play, rather than playing with that child — the skills to do that will come later. At this stage, your little one is still very “self centered” — he is at the center of the world and can’t really empathize or understand things from another point of view. Sharing isn’t really something your 14-month-old will be thinking in terms of yet, and he may get upset if another child takes one of his things — even if he’s offered it to him to begin with.

  • Use real words. Given your little one is starting to understand much more of what you’re saying to him, it's best to use actual words instead of made up ones as much as possible. For example, when you're reading a book with a picture of a sheep, say “sheep” and not “baa baa” when you point to the animal. It will be less confusing for him if he only needs to learn one word per thing at this time.

  • Provide appropriate discipline. Discipline is really about teaching and guiding your 14-month-old rather than punishing him for doing something wrong. At this stage, and in the coming years, your little one will be testing boundaries and discovering his own physical and developmental limits. For example, he might scream in protest if you try to take an object away from him, or he might drop food on the floor even after you’ve told him not to. It will take years of firm but loving “discipline” — in other words, consistent limit setting on your part — for your little one to learn the behavior you expect and to develop the self-discipline needed to be able to act accordingly. It helps for both parents to be on the same page about what the boundaries should be, so have a discussion with your partner (or your child’s other parent) to clarify your approach. Setting boundaries consistently together helps your little one learn the limits more easily, and will help prevent a situation where he tries to pit one of you against the other in the future.

Learn more about the stages of early childhood development in Parent Life.
content.translateValue:
Dette er bare noen av tingene du kan gjøre for å støtte utviklingen til din 14 måneder gamle baby:

  • Involver ham i rutineoppgaver. Småbarn elsker å imitere og være en del av familielivet, så la den lille hjelpe deg med enkle oppgaver rundt i hjemmet. For eksempel, sett på litt musikk og jobb sammen for å legge lekene hans i lekekurven. Målet er å gjøre denne oppgaven morsom og ikke en plikt, så gi ham god tid, hjelp ham med å gjøre en god jobb, og ros ham for å hjelpe til. En annen idé kan være å oppmuntre ham til å hjelpe deg med å sette melken på en lav hylle i kjøleskapet. Å gi ham en feiebrett og kost til å "feie" med er et annet alternativ. Han vil føle seg stolt over at han får hjelpe til med "store gutte"-oppgaver. Dessuten er det å hjelpe en viktig sosial ferdighet som småbarnet ditt gradvis må lære.

  • Oppmuntre til sosiale interaksjoner. Du vil kanskje oppdage at 14-måneders gamle barnet ditt liker å være sammen med andre barn, spesielt de som er litt eldre. Mest sannsynlig vil han leke alene ved siden av et annet barn, noe som kalles parallell lek, i stedet for å leke med det barnet — ferdighetene til å gjøre det kommer senere. På dette stadiet er den lille fortsatt veldig "selvsentrert" — han er i sentrum av verden og kan ikke virkelig føle empati eller forstå ting fra et annet perspektiv. Å dele er ikke noe 14-måneders gamle barnet ditt vil tenke på ennå, og han kan bli opprørt hvis et annet barn tar en av tingene hans — selv om han tilbød det til ham i utgangspunktet.

  • Bruk ekte ord. Siden den lille begynner å forstå mye mer av det du sier til ham, er det best å bruke faktiske ord i stedet for oppdiktede så mye som mulig. For eksempel, når du leser en bok med et bilde av en sau, si "sau" og ikke "bæ bæ" når du peker på dyret. Det vil være mindre forvirrende for ham hvis han bare trenger å lære ett ord per ting på dette tidspunktet.

  • Gi passende disiplin. Disiplin handler egentlig om å lære og veilede din 14 måneder gamle baby i stedet for å straffe ham for å gjøre noe galt. På dette stadiet, og i de kommende årene, vil den lille teste grenser og oppdage sine egne fysiske og utviklingsmessige grenser. For eksempel kan han skrike i protest hvis du prøver å ta en gjenstand fra ham, eller han kan slippe mat på gulvet selv etter at du har sagt til ham at han ikke skal gjøre det. Det vil ta år med fast, men kjærlig "disiplin" — med andre ord, konsekvent grensesetting fra din side — for at den lille skal lære den oppførselen du forventer og utvikle den selvdisiplinen som trengs for å kunne handle deretter. Det hjelper at begge foreldrene er enige om hva grensene skal være, så ha en diskusjon med partneren din (eller barnets andre forelder) for å avklare tilnærmingen deres. Å sette grenser konsekvent sammen hjelper den lille å lære grensene lettere, og vil bidra til å forhindre en situasjon der han prøver å sette dere opp mot hverandre i fremtiden.

Lær mer omstages of early childhood developmenti Foreldrelivet.

content.label: Newborn Milestone tidbits
content.initialValue: Infos croustillantes sur les étapes des nouveau-nés
content.value: Newborn Milestone tidbits
content.translateValue: Infos croustillantes sur les étapes des nouveau-nés

content.value:
• Your toddler will need about 1,000 calories worth of food a day — about three small meals and two hearty snacks — to keep her healthy and energized. Offer nutritious selections from the main food groups: protein foods like meat and eggs, dairy products like cow’s milk and cheese, fruits and vegetables, and wholegrain cereals, pasta, or bread.

  • Although a varied diet of healthy foods usually provides enough vitamins and minerals for most children, some children may need supplements.

    For example, your little one may need supplements of vitamins B2, B12, and calcium if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. If she drinks lots of cow’s milk (much more than about 24 to 32 ounces a day) she may need an iron supplement. Your healthcare provider will be able to recommend any needed For example, your little one may need supplements of vitamins B2, B12, and calcium if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. content.translateValue:
• 네 아이는 하루에 약 1,000칼로리의 음식을 섭취해야 해 — 작은 식사 세 끼와 든든한 간식 두 번 정도 — 건강하고 활기차게 유지하려면 말이야. 주요 식품군에서 영양가 있는 음식을 제공해줘: 고기와 계란 같은 단백질 식품, 우유와 치즈 같은 유제품, 과일과 채소, 그리고 통곡물 시리얼, 파스타, 빵 등이야.

  • 대부분의 아이들은 다양한 건강식으로 충분한 비타민과 미네랄을 섭취할 수 있지만, 일부 아이들은 보충제가 필요할 수 있어.

    예를 들어, 엄격한 채식주의 식단을 따르는 경우, 아기에게 비타민 B2, B12, 칼슘 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 만약 아기가 하루에 약 24~32온스 이상의 우유를 많이 마신다면 철분 보충제가 필요할 수도 있어. 필요하다면 의료 제공자가 추천해 줄 거야.

  • 너의 유아는 하루에 약 1,000칼로리의 음식을 필요로 해 — 대략 세 번의 작은 식사와 두 번의 든든한 간식 — 그녀를 건강하고 활기차게 유지하기 위해서야. 주요 식품군에서 영양가 있는 선택을 제공해: 고기와 계란 같은 단백질 식품, 우유와 치즈 같은 유제품, 과일과 채소, 그리고 통곡물 시리얼, 파스타, 또는 빵.

    대부분의 아이들에게는 다양한 건강식이 충분한 비타민과 미네랄을 제공하지만, 일부 아이들은 보충제가 필요할 수 있어.

  • 예를 들어, 엄격한 채식주의 식단을 따르는 경우 아기가 비타민 B2, B12, 그리고 칼슘 보충제를 필요로 할 수 있어. 만약 아기가 하루에 약 24~32온스보다 훨씬 더 많은 소젖을 마신다면 철분 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 필요한 경우, 의료 제공자가 추천해 줄 거야.

  • 예를 들어, 엄격한 채식주의 식단을 따르는 경우, 아기에게 비타민 B2, B12, 그리고 칼슘 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 만약 아기가 하루에 약 24~32온스 이상의 소젖을 많이 마신다면 철분 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 필요한 보충제는 건강 관리 제공자가 추천해 줄 거야.

  • 예를 들어, 엄격한 채식주의 식단을 따르는 경우, 아기에게 비타민 B2, B12 및 칼슘 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 만약 아기가 하루에 약 24에서 32온스 이상의 우유를 많이 마신다면 철분 보충제가 필요할 수도 있어. 필요한 경우, 담당 의사가 추천해 줄 거야.

    예를 들어, 엄격한 채식주의 식단을 따르는 경우, 아기에게 비타민 B2, B12, 칼슘 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 만약 아기가 하루에 약 24~32온스 이상의 우유를 많이 마신다면 철분 보충제가 필요할 수도 있어. 필요하다면 의료 제공자가 추천해 줄 거야.

  • 너의 유아는 하루에 약 1,000칼로리의 음식을 필요로 해 — 대략 세 번의 작은 식사와 두 번의 든든한 간식 — 그녀를 건강하고 활기차게 유지하기 위해서야. 주요 식품군에서 영양가 있는 선택을 제공해: 고기와 계란 같은 단백질 식품, 우유와 치즈 같은 유제품, 과일과 채소, 그리고 통곡물 시리얼, 파스타, 또는 빵.

  • 예를 들어, 엄격한 채식주의 식단을 따르는 경우 아기가 비타민 B2, B12, 그리고 칼슘 보충제를 필요로 할 수 있어. 만약 아기가 하루에 약 24~32온스보다 훨씬 더 많은 소젖을 마신다면 철분 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 필요한 경우, 의료 제공자가 추천해 줄 거야.

• Your toddler will need about 1,000 calories worth of food a day — about three small meals and two hearty snacks — to keep her healthy and energized. Offer nutritious selections from the main food groups: protein foods like meat and eggs, dairy products like cow’s milk and cheese, fruits and vegetables, and wholegrain cereals, pasta, or bread.

  • Although a varied diet of healthy foods usually provides enough vitamins and minerals for most children, some children may need supplements.

    For example, your little one may need supplements of vitamins B2, B12, and calcium if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. If she drinks lots of cow’s milk (much more than about 24 to 32 ounces a day) she may need an iron supplement.   • 예를 들어, 엄격한 채식주의 식단을 따르는 경우, 아기에게 비타민 B2, B12, 그리고 칼슘 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 만약 아기가 하루에 약 24~32온스 이상의 소젖을 많이 마신다면 철분 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 필요한 보충제는 건강 관리 제공자가 추천해 줄 거야.

  • 예를 들어, 엄격한 채식주의 식단을 따르는 경우, 아기에게 비타민 B2, B12 및 칼슘 보충제가 필요할 수 있어. 만약 아기가 하루에 약 24에서 32온스 이상의 우유를 많이 마신다면 철분 보충제가 필요할 수도 있어. 필요한 경우, 담당 의사가 추천해 줄 거야.

content.label: Nature
content.value:
• Your toddler will need about 1,000 calories worth of food a day — about three small meals and two hearty snacks — to keep her healthy and energized. Offer nutritious selections from the main food groups: protein foods like meat and eggs, dairy products like cow’s milk and cheese, fruits and vegetables, and wholegrain cereals, pasta, or bread.

  • Although a varied diet of healthy foods usually provides enough vitamins and minerals for most children, some children may need supplements.

    For example, your little one may need supplements of vitamins B2, B12, and calcium if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. If she drinks lots of cow’s milk (much more than about 24 to 32 ounces a day) she may need an iron supplement. Your healthcare provider will be able to recommend any needed For example, your little one may need supplements of vitamins B2, B12, and calcium if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. If she drinks lots of cow’s milk (much more than about 24 to 32 ounces a day) she may need an iron supplement. Your healthcare provider will be able to recommend any needed.

content.translateValue:
• Ton tout-petit aura besoin d'environ 1 000 calories de nourriture par jour — environ trois petits repas et deux collations copieuses — pour rester en bonne santé et plein d'énergie. Propose des choix nutritifs provenant des principaux groupes alimentaires : des aliments protéinés comme la viande et les œufs, des produits laitiers comme le lait de vache et le fromage, des fruits et légumes, et des céréales complètes, des pâtes ou du pain.

  • Bien qu'une alimentation variée et saine fournisse généralement suffisamment de vitamines et de minéraux à la plupart des enfants, certains peuvent avoir besoin de compléments.

    Par exemple, ton petit bout pourrait avoir besoin de suppléments de vitamines B2, B12 et de calcium si ta famille suit un régime végétarien strict. Si elle boit beaucoup de lait de vache (bien plus que 24 à 32 onces par jour), elle pourrait avoir besoin d'un supplément de fer. Ton prestataire de soins de santé pourra te recommander ce dont tu as besoin.

  • Ton tout-petit aura besoin d'environ 1 000 calories de nourriture par jour — environ trois petits repas et deux collations copieuses — pour rester en bonne santé et plein d'énergie. Propose des choix nutritifs parmi les principaux groupes alimentaires : des aliments protéinés comme la viande et les œufs, des produits laitiers comme le lait de vache et le fromage, des fruits et légumes, et des céréales complètes, pâtes ou pain.

    Bien qu'une alimentation variée et saine fournisse généralement suffisamment de vitamines et de minéraux pour la plupart des enfants, certains enfants peuvent avoir besoin de compléments.

  • Par exemple, ton petit bout pourrait avoir besoin de suppléments de vitamines B2, B12 et de calcium si ta famille suit un régime végétarien strict. Si elle boit beaucoup de lait de vache (bien plus que 24 à 32 onces par jour), elle pourrait avoir besoin d'un supplément de fer. Ton prestataire de soins de santé pourra te recommander ce qui est nécessaire.

  • Par exemple, ta petite pourrait avoir besoin de suppléments de vitamines B2, B12 et de calcium si ta famille suit un régime végétarien strict. Si elle boit beaucoup de lait de vache (beaucoup plus que 24 à 32 onces par jour), elle pourrait avoir besoin d'un supplément de fer. Ton prestataire de soins de santé pourra te recommander ce qui est nécessaire.

  • Par exemple, ton petit bout pourrait avoir besoin de suppléments de vitamines B2, B12 et de calcium si ta famille suit un régime végétarien strict. Si elle boit beaucoup de lait de vache (beaucoup plus que 700 à 950 ml par jour), elle pourrait avoir besoin d'un supplément de fer. Ton prestataire de soins de santé pourra te recommander ce qui est nécessaire.

  • Bien qu'une alimentation variée et équilibrée fournisse généralement suffisamment de vitamines et de minéraux à la plupart des enfants, certains peuvent avoir besoin de compléments alimentaires.

  • Par exemple, ta petite pourrait avoir besoin de suppléments de vitamines B2, B12 et de calcium si ta famille suit un régime végétarien strict. Elle pourrait avoir besoin d'un supplément de fer si elle boit beaucoup de lait de vache (bien plus que 700 à 950 ml par jour). Ton prestataire de soins de santé pourra te recommander ce dont elle a besoin.

content.value:
• Your toddler will need about 1,000 calories worth of food a day — about three small meals and two hearty snacks — to keep her healthy and energized. Offer nutritious selections from the main food groups: protein foods like meat and eggs, dairy products like cow’s milk and cheese, fruits and vegetables, and wholegrain cereals, pasta, or bread.

  • Although a varied diet of healthy foods usually provides enough vitamins and minerals for most children, some children may need supplements.

  • For example, your little one may need vitamins B2, B12, and calcium supplements if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. She may need an iron supplement if she drinks lots of cow’s milk (much more than 24 to 32 ounces a day). Your healthcare provider can recommend any needed For example, your little one may need supplements of vitamins B2, B12, and calcium if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. She may need an iron supplement if she drinks lots of cow’s milk (much more than 24 to 32 ounces a day). Your healthcare provider will be able to recommend any needed

Elle pourrait avoir besoin d'un supplément de fer si elle boit beaucoup de lait de vache (bien plus de 700 à 950 ml par jour). Ton professionnel de santé pourra te recommander ce qui est nécessaire.

content.label: Daily Schedule - A Day in the Life of Your Toddler - 14 months
content.value:
Life with a 14-month-old is never dull. Here’s what a typical day might include at your house:

Sleeping

  • Between 12 and 14 hours of sleep per day

  • One or two naps a day

  • Being excited about walking may disrupt the sleep schedule

Eating

  • Your toddler needs about 1,000 calories a day

  • Offer a wide range of healthy food

  • Serve healthy snacks instead of sugary treats

  • Ask your child's healthcare provider about supplements

Developmental Activities

  • Have "conversations" with your toddler

  • Name objects and body parts to help your child learn the words

  • Encourage playing with objects that develop fine motor skills like blocks and soft toys

  • Give your toddler lots of opportunities to move, crawl, and walk

  • Let your child self-feed using unbreakable spoon, bowl, and cup

You work to be prepared for each day, but sometimes routines get disrupted. Find out how these disruptions impact your little one and what you can do when they happen.
content.translateValue:
La vie avec un enfant de 14 mois n’est jamais ennuyeuse. Voici ce à quoi peut ressembler une journée type chez vous :

Sommeil

  • entre 12 et 14 heures de sommeil par jour;

  • une ou deux siestes par jour;

  • l’enthousiasme pour la marche peut perturber l’horaire de sommeil.

Alimentation

  • votre tout-petit a besoin d’environ 1 000 calories par jour;

  • proposez une large gamme d’aliments sains;

  • servez des collations saines au lieu de friandises sucrées;

  • demandez au prestataire de soins de santé de votre enfant de vous parler des suppléments.

Activités de développement

  • ayez des « conversations » avec votre tout-petit;

  • nommez les objets et les parties du corps pour aider votre enfant à apprendre les mots;

  • encouragez-le à jouer avec des objets qui favorisent le développement de la motricité fine, comme les blocs et les jouets souples;

  • donnez à votre tout-petit de nombreuses occasions de bouger, de ramper et de marcher;

  • laissez votre enfant s’alimenter lui-même en utilisant une cuillère, un bol et une tasse incassables.

content.label: 14 Months Old
content.value:
At 14 months old, your toddler may be revealing more and more of his personality. For example, you may find he understands more of what you say, and that he may be determined to keep going with a favorite activity even when it's time for bed.

There’s a lot you can do to support your toddler’s happy and healthy development, and to help him feel safe and secure while he explores his world in more independent ways. Read on to find out how you can navigate issues like separation anxiety and sibling dynamics at this time.

We also outline some development milestones your 14-month-old may reach around this time, and offer some tips on mealtimes and sleep that you may find helpful. Life is full with a toddler in the house, and this month is no exception. Let’s dive right in.
content.translateValue:
À 14 mois, ton tout-petit peut révéler de plus en plus de sa personnalité. Par exemple, tu peux constater qu'il comprend mieux ce que tu dis et qu'il est déterminé à continuer une activité favorite même lorsqu'il est l'heure de se coucher.

Il y a beaucoup de choses que tu peux faire pour soutenir le développement heureux et sain de ton tout-petit, et pour l'aider à se sentir en sécurité pendant qu'il explore son monde de manière plus indépendante. Continue de lire pour découvrir comment gérer des problèmes comme l'anxiété de séparation et la dynamique entre frères et sœurs à cette période.

Nous décrivons également certains jalons de développement que ton enfant de 14 mois pourrait atteindre à cette période, et offrons quelques conseils sur les repas et le sommeil qui pourraient t'être utiles. La vie est bien remplie avec un tout-petit à la maison, et ce mois-ci ne fait pas exception. Allons-y.

content.label: Health & Safety - Your Toddler’s Health and Safety - 14 Months
content.value: Health & Safety

content.label: Health & Safety - Your Toddler’s Health and Safety - 14 Months
content.value:
• As your toddler becomes more mobile, it’s important to hold her hand and keep an eye on her, particularly when you’re out and about together.

  • For example, don’t let her dart away from you in the grocery store, and be particularly vigilant when you’re near cars, such as on the street or in a parking lot. Be very careful anywhere around water, too.

  • Because your little one can wander off in an instant, the best strategy is to hold her hand. If she tries to wriggle free, you can say something like “I know you want to look over there, but I need to hold your hand to make sure you’re safe.”

  • You might also like to install extra locks to doors and gates, as well as baby gates or even alarms, to ensure your toddler can’t get out of the house without your knowledge. It’s especially important that the pool and driveway are inaccessible to your 14-month-old.

  • Although many new cars come with a rear visibility system or an alarm that can detect movement behind the car, always double check that your toddler is not behind you as you back out of the driveway.

  • When it comes to car safety, be sure keep your car locked at all times, even when it’s in the garage. This helps prevent your toddler getting into the car and accidentally setting it in gear, or becoming trapped in the car and developing heatstroke.
content.translateValue:
• À mesure que ton tout-petit devient plus mobile, il est important de lui tenir la main et de le surveiller, surtout lorsque vous êtes en déplacement ensemble.

  • Par exemple, ne la laisse pas s'éloigner de toi dans l'épicerie et sois particulièrement vigilant près des voitures, comme dans la rue ou dans un stationnement. Sois aussi très prudent près de l'eau.

  • Parce que ton petit peut s'éloigner en un instant, la meilleure stratégie est de lui tenir la main. Si elle essaie de se dégager, tu peux dire quelque chose comme « Je sais que tu veux regarder là-bas, mais j'ai besoin de te tenir la main pour m'assurer que tu es en sécurité. »

  • Tu pourrais aussi installer des verrous supplémentaires aux portes et aux portails, ainsi que des barrières de sécurité pour bébé ou même des alarmes, pour t'assurer que ton tout-petit ne puisse pas sortir de la maison sans que tu le saches. Il est particulièrement important que la piscine et l'allée soient inaccessibles à ton enfant de 14 mois.

  • Bien que de nombreuses voitures neuves soient équipées d'un système de visibilité arrière ou d'une alarme pouvant détecter les mouvements derrière la voiture, vérifie toujours que ton tout-petit n'est pas derrière toi lorsque tu recules de l'allée.

  • En matière de sécurité automobile, assure-toi de garder ta voiture verrouillée en tout temps, même lorsqu'elle est dans le garage. Cela aide à empêcher ton tout-petit de monter dans la voiture et de la mettre accidentellement en marche, ou de rester coincé dans la voiture et de souffrir d'un coup de chaleur.

content.value: À mesure que ton tout-petit devient plus mobile, il est important de lui tenir la main et de le surveiller, surtout lorsque vous êtes en déplacement ensemble.
Par exemple, ne la laisse pas s'éloigner de toi dans l'épicerie et sois particulièrement vigilant près des voitures, comme dans la rue ou dans un stationnement. Sois aussi très prudent près de l'eau.

Parce que ton petit peut s'éloigner en un instant, la meilleure stratégie est de lui tenir la main. Si elle essaie de se dégager, tu peux dire quelque chose comme « Je sais que tu veux regarder là-bas, mais j'ai besoin de te tenir la main pour m'assurer que tu es en sécurité. »

Tu pourrais aussi installer des verrous supplémentaires aux portes et aux portails, ainsi que des barrières de sécurité pour bébé ou même des alarmes, pour t'assurer que ton tout-petit ne puisse pas sortir de la maison sans que tu le saches. Il est particulièrement important que la piscine et l'allée soient inaccessibles à ton enfant de 14 mois.

Bien que de nombreuses voitures neuves soient équipées d'un système de visibilité arrière ou d'une alarme pouvant détecter les mouvements derrière la voiture, vérifie toujours que ton tout-petit n'est pas derrière toi lorsque tu recules de l'allée.

En matière de sécurité automobile, assure-toi de garder ta voiture verrouillée en tout temps, même lorsqu'elle est dans le garage. Cela aide à empêcher ton tout-petit de monter dans la voiture et de la mettre accidentellement en marche, ou de rester coincé dans la voiture et de souffrir d'un coup de chaleur.

content.label: Life as a Parent - Your Life as a Parent: Sibling Dynamics - 14 Months
content.value: Life as a Parent

content.label: Life as a Parent - Your Life as a Parent: Sibling Dynamics - 14 Months
content.value:
If you have older children, you may notice a slight change in the dynamic now that your littlest one is a toddler. As we’ve described, your toddler is the center of her own universe, and this can make her behave in ways that your older children may find annoying.

For example, your 14-month-old might infringe on her siblings' privacy, take their things as her own, and throw a tantrum if they take their things back.

On the other hand, your older children may be jealous that your 14-month-old gets more of your attention.

Depending on the age of your older child, you may find she is doing things, like misbehaving, just to get your attention.

The sibling rivalry should diminish in the years to come as your children need less of your focused attention.

In the meantime, make an effort to spend some quality time with each of your children. Perhaps have your partner, family member, or babysitter mind one while you enjoy some one-on-one time or a fun outing with the other, and vice versa.

Maybe you're an adoptive parent. If so, check out our expert-led tips on
content.translateValue:
Si tu as des enfants plus âgés, tu pourrais remarquer un léger changement dans la dynamique maintenant que ton petit dernier est un tout-petit. Comme nous l'avons décrit, ton tout-petit est le centre de son propre univers, et cela peut la faire se comporter de manière agaçante pour tes enfants plus âgés.

Par exemple, ta fille de 14 mois pourrait empiéter sur la vie privée de ses frères et sœurs, prendre leurs affaires comme si c'étaient les siennes, et faire une crise de colère s'ils reprennent leurs affaires.

D'un autre côté, tes enfants plus âgés pourraient être jaloux que ton enfant de 14 mois reçoive plus de ton attention.

Selon l'âge de ton enfant aîné, tu pourrais remarquer qu'elle fait des choses, comme se conduire mal, juste pour attirer ton attention.

La rivalité entre frères et sœurs devrait diminuer dans les années à venir, car tes enfants auront moins besoin de ton attention soutenue.

En attendant, prends le temps de passer des moments de qualité avec chacun de tes enfants. Demande peut-être à ton partenaire, un membre de ta famille ou une gardienne de s'occuper de l'un pendant que tu profites d'un moment en tête-à-tête ou d'une sortie amusante avec l'autre, et vice versa.

Peut-être es-tu un parent adoptif. Si c'est le cas, consulte nos conseils d'experts sur

content.label: Feeding - Mealtimes and Menus for Your 14-Month-Old
content.value:
Your toddler will need about 1,000 calories worth of food a day — about three small meals and two hearty snacks — to keep her healthy and energized. Offer nutritious selections from the main food groups: protein foods like meat and eggs, dairy products like cow’s milk and cheese, fruits and vegetables, and wholegrain cereals, pasta, or bread.

Although a varied diet of healthy foods usually provides enough vitamins and minerals for most children, some children may need supplements.

For example, your little one may need supplements of vitamins B2, B12, and calcium if your family follows a strict vegetarian diet. If she drinks lots of cow’s milk (much more than about 24 to 32 ounces a day) she may need an iron supplement. Your healthcare provider will be able to recommend any needed supplements.
content.translateValue:
Tu pequeño necesitará aproximadamente 1.000 calorías en alimentos al día — unas tres comidas pequeñas y dos meriendas sustanciosas — para mantenerla saludable y llena de energía. Ofrece opciones nutritivas de los principales grupos de alimentos: proteínas como carne y huevos, productos lácteos como leche de vaca y queso, frutas y verduras, y cereales integrales, pasta o pan.

Aunque una dieta variada de alimentos saludables generalmente proporciona suficientes vitaminas y minerales para la mayoría de los niños, algunos pueden necesitar suplementos.

Por ejemplo, tu pequeño podría necesitar suplementos de vitaminas B2, B12 y calcio si tu familia sigue una dieta vegetariana estricta. Si toma mucha leche de vaca (mucho más de aproximadamente 24 a 32 onzas al día), podría necesitar un suplemento de hierro. Tu proveedor de atención médica podrá recomendar los suplementos necesarios.

content.label: Development Support - How to Support Your 14-Month-Old’s Development
content.value: Development Support

content.label: Development Support - How to Support Your 14-Month-Old’s Development
content.value:
These are just some of the things you can do to support your 14-month-old’s development:

  • Involve him in routine tasks. Toddlers love to imitate and be included in family life, so let your little help you with simple jobs around the home. For example, put some music on and work together to put his toys into his toy basket. The aim is to make this task fun and not a chore, so give him lots of time, help him do a good job, and praise him for helping out. Another idea could be to encourage him to help you put the milk away in a low shelf of the fridge. Giving him a dustpan and brush to “sweep” with is another option. He’ll feel proud that he gets to help with “big boy” jobs. Plus, helping is an important social skill that your toddler will need to slowly learn.

  • Encourage social interactions. You may find that your 14-month-old enjoys being with other children, especially those who are a little older. Most likely he will play by himself alongside another child, which is called parallel play, rather than playing with that child — the skills to do that will come later. At this stage, your little one is still very “self centered” — he is at the center of the world and can’t really empathize or understand things from another point of view. Sharing isn’t really something your 14-month-old will be thinking in terms of yet, and he may get upset if another child takes one of his things — even if he’s offered it to him to begin with.

  • Use real words. Given your little one is starting to understand much more of what you’re saying to him, it's best to use actual words instead of made up ones as much as possible. For example, when you're reading a book with a picture of a sheep, say “sheep” and not “baa baa” when you point to the animal. It will be less confusing for him if he only needs to learn one word per thing at this time.

  • Provide appropriate discipline. Discipline is really about teaching and guiding your 14-month-old rather than punishing him for doing something wrong. At this stage, and in the coming years, your little one will be testing boundaries and discovering his own physical and developmental limits. For example, he might scream in protest if you try to take an object away from him, or he might drop food on the floor even after you’ve told him not to. It will take years of firm but loving “discipline” — in other words, consistent limit setting on your part — for your little one to learn the behavior you expect and to develop the self-discipline needed to be able to act accordingly. It helps for both parents to be on the same page about what the boundaries should be, so have a discussion with your partner (or your child’s other parent) to clarify your approach. Setting boundaries consistently together helps your little one learn the limits more easily, and will help prevent a situation where he tries to pit one of you against the other in the future.

Learn more about the stages of early childhood development in Parent Life.
content.translateValue:
Como padres, naturalmente quieres solo lo mejor para tu tesoro. Pero cada niño nace con diferentes habilidades y fortalezas. Por lo tanto, tu hijo también se desarrollará a su propio ritmo. Algunos niños pequeños aprenden a hablar temprano, pero comienzan a caminar más tarde, en otros puede ser exactamente al revés. Tu hijo de 14 meses ya es una pequeña personita con sus propias preferencias y fortalezas. Esto se refleja, entre otras cosas, en qué habilidades aprende tu hijo más fácilmente y rápidamente, y con cuáles se toma un poco más de tiempo. Ya sea que tu niño pequeño esté experimentando un estirón de crecimiento en su 14º mes de vida o no: cada niño quiere crecer y aprender desde el nacimiento. El desarrollo avanza a veces más rápido, a veces más lento y depende de los siguientes factores:

  • los rasgos físicos y mentales heredados

  • la maduración biológica del cuerpo y de los órganos,

  • Sugerencias de padres, familia y cuidadores

  • Así como las experiencias que tu hijo haya vivido.

Como padres, no podéis realmente acelerar este proceso. Tampoco es necesario. Confía en tu hijo y en la naturaleza: cuando llegue el momento, tu hijo dará el siguiente paso en su desarrollo. La mejor manera de apoyar a tu pequeño de 14 meses es dándole la oportunidad de acumular sus propias experiencias. Los límites son importantes, pero tu hijo también debe tener la mayor libertad posible para desarrollarse y experimentar. Lo que tu pequeño tesoro encuentra interesante en este momento depende mucho de su edad y de las habilidades que está desarrollando. La curiosidad de tu pequeño explorador no se puede despertar arbitrariamente. En lugar de eso, observa con qué le gusta jugar a tu hijo de 14 meses. Tal vez esté concentrado mirando un libro de imágenes, jugando con un objeto cotidiano o simplemente lanzando un bloque de construcción. Tu hijo descubre de manera lúdica para qué sirve cada objeto y qué se puede hacer con él. A menudo son cosas muy simples las que fascinan a los pequeños. Juegos como lanzar una pelota, construir torres o jugar al escondite ayudan a tu tesoro a entender cómo funciona el mundo. Por eso no es necesario ofrecer siempre cosas nuevas y mucha variedad. Al contrario, muchos niños son más felices y están más satisfechos con menos.

content.label: Skills & Abilities - Toddler Development Milestones - 14 Months
content.value: Skills & Abilities

content.label: Skills & Abilities - Toddler Development Milestones - 14 Months
content.value:
If you have an older child, or are connecting with other parents of young children, you probably have noticed a difference in when development milestones are reached by individual children.

This is normal and expected, as each child is special and unique.

With this in mind, think of the milestones listed here as the kinds of things you might observe around this time. Some may have happened a little earlier for your toddler, while others won't occur until your child is older than 14 months. Speak to your healthcare provider if you’re ever concerned about your toddler’s development.

These are some general areas of improvement and achievement you may observe in your toddler:

  • Language comprehension. Have you noticed that your little one can point to his favorite teddy when you ask him to show you where it is? Or that he’s waiting by his high chair when you tell him his snack is almost ready? This is happening because your toddler is understanding a lot more of what you say. To help boost his comprehension and language skills, keep talking to him about what’s going on around him and respond to what he says and does. Speaking to him slowly and clearly, and using simple words and short sentences, will also help him understand. Around this time, you may find yourself using less “baby talk” as it’s no longer needed to get his attention.

  • Flashes of independence and dependence. You might find your 14-month-old becoming bolder and more confident in his attitude and behavior. He might walk away from you to do something you’ve just told him not to do, or play on his own in a more independent way than before. At other times, he might seem especially clingy, perhaps when he’s feeling tired or anxious. The transition toward greater independence is not linear. For example, you may find he’s very independent for several days before suddenly becoming more dependent on you again. This push-pull between wanting to be his own person and needing to be right next to you is normal, and it’s a sign that your toddler is getting used to the idea of growing up. Support your toddler by offering reassurance when he needs it. Don’t try to force him to do something when he’s not feeling confident, as this may make him feel more insecure.

  • Separation anxiety. It's not unusual for a 14-month-old to put up a fuss when you leave him. One strategy that may help reduce separation anxiety is to let him know what's happening: tell him you're going, that you’ll soon return, and then give him a quick kiss before leaving. Don’t sneak off, as this can make him fearful that you’ll disappear at any time. Plus, try not to reveal any anxiety of your own about the separation, which could make him fuss even more in the hopes that you’ll stay. Once you return, give him lots of attention. In time, he’ll understand that you’ll always return and that leaving doesn’t mean you don’t love him.

  • Self-feeding. Your little one is getting better and better at feeding himself with a spoon or his fingers, and drinking from a cup, too. Although some of the food may not make it into his mouth, he’ll eventually achieve success. Unbreakable dishes and cups are a good idea, as they may be dropped or even flung from time to time. If your toddler does throw something like dishes or cutlery across the room, tell him that’s not allowed, and put things back where they belong. If your 14-month-old keeps dropping or throwing objects to see you react, it might be a good idea to take him out of the high chair and give him a chance to calm down before trying mealtime again later on.

  • Toddling. If your 14-month-old is walking, this may look quite different from the way older children or adults walk. At this stage, toddlers step with a wide gait, toes pointed outward, and the steps can be shaky. Your child may seem to lurch forward from one foot to the other, with his arms bent at shoulder height for balance. It all looks very tentative and slow right now — particularly when he loses balance and falls — but it won’t be long before you’ll be running to catch up with him. And if your 14-month-old hasn’t taken his first steps yet, don't worry. This is a development milestone that will likely be reached in the next few months.

To learn more about understanding and boosting your little one's skills and abilities, check out our information on Play & Childhood Development.
content.translateValue:
Si tienes un hijo mayor o estás en contacto con otros padres de niños pequeños, probablemente hayas notado diferencias en el momento en que cada niño alcanza los momentos importantes del desarrollo.

Es normal y esperado, ya que cada niño es especial y único.

Teniendo esto en cuenta, considera los momentos importantes mencionados aquí como las cosas que podrías observar alrededor de esta época. Algunos pueden haber ocurrido un poco antes en tu pequeño, mientras que otros no sucederán hasta que tu hijo sea mayor de 14 meses. Habla con tu proveedor de salud si alguna vez te preocupa el desarrollo de tu pequeño.

Estas son algunas áreas generales de mejora y logro que podrías observar en tu pequeño:

  • Comprensión del lenguaje. ¿Has notado que tu pequeño señala su osito favorito cuando le pides que te muestre dónde está? ¿O que espera junto a su trona cuando le dices que su merienda ya casi está lista? Esto sucede porque tu niño pequeño está comprendiendo mucho más de lo que dices. Para ayudar a impulsar su comprensión y habilidades lingüísticas, sigue hablándole sobre lo que sucede a su alrededor y responde a lo que dice y hace. Hablarle despacio y claramente, utilizando palabras sencillas y frases cortas, también le ayudará a entender. Alrededor de esta época, podrías encontrarte usando menos el "habla de bebé", ya que ya no es necesario para captar su atención.

  • Destellos de independencia y dependencia. Podrías notar que tu pequeño de 14 meses se vuelve más audaz y confiado en su actitud y comportamiento. Puede que se aleje de ti para hacer algo que le acabas de decir que no haga, o juegue solo de una manera más independiente que antes. En otros momentos, puede parecer especialmente apegado, quizás cuando se siente cansado o ansioso. La transición hacia una mayor independencia no es lineal. Por ejemplo, puedes descubrir que es muy independiente durante varios días antes de que de repente vuelva a depender más de ti. Este tira y afloja entre querer ser su propia persona y necesitar estar justo a tu lado es normal, y es una señal de que tu pequeño se está acostumbrando a la idea de crecer. Apoya a tu pequeño ofreciéndole seguridad cuando la necesite. No intentes forzarlo a hacer algo cuando no se siente seguro, ya que esto podría hacerlo sentir más inseguro.

  • La ansiedad por separación. No es raro que un niño de 14 meses haga un berrinche cuando te vas. Una estrategia que puede ayudar a reducir la ansiedad por separación es hacerle saber lo que está sucediendo: dile que te vas, que volverás pronto y luego dale un beso rápido antes de salir. No te escabullas, ya que esto puede hacerle temer que desaparecerás en cualquier momento. Además, intenta no mostrar ninguna ansiedad propia sobre la separación, lo que podría hacer que se altere aún más con la esperanza de que te quedes. Una vez que regreses, dale mucha atención. Con el tiempo, entenderá que siempre volverás y que irse no significa que no lo amas.

  • Alimentación autónoma. Tu pequeño está mejorando cada vez más en alimentarse solo con una cuchara o sus dedos, y también en beber de un vaso. Aunque parte de la comida puede no llegar a su boca, eventualmente logrará el éxito. Los platos y vasos irrompibles son una buena idea, ya que pueden caerse o incluso ser lanzados de vez en cuando. Si tu peque lanza algo como platos o cubiertos por la habitación, dile que eso no se hace, y vuelve a poner las cosas en su lugar. Si tu pequeño de 14 meses sigue tirando o lanzando objetos para ver tu reacción, podría ser buena idea sacarlo de la silla alta y darle la oportunidad de calmarse antes de intentar de nuevo la hora de comer más tarde.

  • Gateo. Si tu pequeño de 14 meses está caminando, esto puede verse muy distinto a la forma en que lo hacen los niños mayores o los adultos. En esta etapa, los niños pequeños dan pasos con una marcha amplia, los dedos de los pies hacia afuera y los pasos pueden ser inestables. Tu hijo puede parecer que se lanza hacia adelante de un pie a otro, con los brazos doblados a la altura de los hombros para equilibrarse. Todo se ve muy tentativo y lento ahora, especialmente cuando pierde el equilibrio y cae, pero no pasará mucho tiempo antes de que estés corriendo para alcanzarlo. Y si tu pequeño de 14 meses aún no ha dado sus primeros pasos, no te preocupes. Este es un momento importante del desarrollo que probablemente se alcanzará en los próximos meses.

Para saber más sobre cómo entender y potenciar las habilidades y capacidades de tu pequeño, consulta nuestra información enPlay & Childhood Development.

content.value:
Buenas noticias: El sistema inmunológico de tu hijo se ha vuelto mucho más fuerte con el tiempo. A los 14 meses, tu valiente caballerito puede combatir mejor los gérmenes dañinos.

Además, el sentido del gusto de tu pequeño se ha desarrollado más. Esto aumenta la diversión de probar diferentes alimentos. Y cuantas más muelitas le salgan, más fácil le resultará a tu monstruito probar nuevos alimentos y, sobre todo, masticarlos.

Tu hijo ha crecido enormemente desde el nacimiento hasta los 14 meses y ha ganado bastante peso. Seguro que has seguido este desarrollo con entusiasmo y quizá has registrado su crecimiento de alguna manera.

¿Pero qué hay de su cabellera? Como todos los niños de esta edad, tu bebé de 14 meses ya ha perdido el vello suave de recién nacido. Ahora comienzan a brotar los cabellos permanentes.

Si a tu pequeño de 14 meses solo le han salido unos pocos pelillos en la cabeza, no te preocupes. La cabellera completa llegará. Ten un poco de paciencia.

Cómo y cuándo crece el cabello varía de un niño a otro. Los responsables son los genes. Ellos determinan:
El color de cabello
ya sea que tu cabello sea liso, ondulado o rizado,
la velocidad a la que crece
y la plenitud del cabello.

Todos estos factores se determinan desde el momento de la concepción. Sin embargo, no sabrás cómo será el cabello de tu hijo hasta que comience la pubertad. Durante ese tiempo, el cambio hormonal será responsable de que el cabello se oscurezca un poco más.

Incluso trucos como el cepillado regular, productos especiales o un corte de pelo temprano no influirán en el color, la densidad o el crecimiento del cabello. Por lo tanto, se necesita paciencia. Pero esa paciencia valdrá la pena: después del primer corte de pelo, tu pequeño seguramente se verá aún más adorable que antes, si eso es posible.

content.label: Life as a Parent - Your Life as a Parent - 1 Month
content.value:
A Problem Shared Is a Problem Halved

You might be feeling more confident this month as some of the uncertainty you may have felt during the first few weeks starts to fade away. Still, talk about any concerns you have with trusted loved ones or your healthcare provider.

A problem shared is a problem halved, and you might be surprised how much better you feel afterward.

If you're breastfeeding, you might experience discomfort resulting from a breast infection called mastitis. Contact your healthcare provider if you notice symptoms such as sore breasts, fever, or nausea.

Don’t stop nursing as this will make things worse. Keep in mind that it’s safe for your baby to nurse when you have mastitis — the milk is not infected. Treatment for mastitis includes expressing milk from your breasts either by feeding or pumping, but your provider may also recommend antibiotics.

Get plenty of rest and drink lots of water to help your body fight the infection.

As you're learning about Life as a Parent, check out "Navigating New Mom Emotions Hormones and Expectations" in Parent Life.
content.translateValue:
Un problème partagé est un problème à moitié résolu

Vous pourriez vous sentir plus confiante ce mois-ci, car l’incertitude que vous avez pu ressentir au cours des premières semaines commence à s’estomper. Néanmoins, parlez de toutes préoccupations que vous avez avec des proches de confiance ou votre fournisseur de soins de santé.

Un problème partagé est un problème à moitié résolu, et vous pourriez être surprise de voir à quel point vous vous sentirez mieux après.

Si vous allaitez, vous pourriez ressentir un inconfort dû à une infection du sein appelée mastite. Communiquez avec votre fournisseur de soins de santé si vous remarquez des symptômes tels que des douleurs mammaires, de la fièvre ou des nausées.

Ne cessez pas d’allaiter, car cela aggraverait les choses. Gardez à l’esprit qu’il n’y a pas de danger à ce que votre bébé soit allaité lorsque vous avez une mastite; le lait n’est pas infecté. Le traitement de la mastite consiste à extraire le lait de vos seins, soit par allaitement, soit par pompage. Votre médecin peut également vous recommander des antibiotiques.

Reposez-vous beaucoup et buvez beaucoup d’eau pour aider votre corps à combattre l’infection.

content.label: Checklist for This Month - 14 Months
content.value: Checklist

content.label: Checklist for This Month - 14 Months
content.value:
• Coordinate with your partner about how you communicate around your toddler. You may find this has already happened organically, but now that your toddler understands more of what you say, you may like to agree with your partner to spell out certain words so that your 14-month-old can’t understand. For example, “Time for the P-L-A-Y-G-R-O-U-N-D?” You may also want to remind each other to watch what you say around your little one, so that her growing vocabulary doesn’t accidentally include something a little more colorful than you’d expected.

  • Arrange for your child’s first haircut. If your toddler’s locks are getting quite long, it may be time for her first haircut! Of course, some children may have already had a trim, while for others it may be a little ways off.

  • Create a dinner ideas list and meal plan. As things get busier at your home, you may find it helpful to create a weekly meal plan. This way you’ll know exactly what to buy, and you won’t be stuck on what to make. You might also like to keep a list of meals that are healthy and popular in your home so that when you don’t have inspiration you can look back at what’s worked in the past. You could even take picture of meals and save them on your phone so you can quickly flip through them when you’re looking for ideas.

  • Schedule your child's 15-month well-child visit. At this checkup, your toddler’s healthcare provider will weigh and measure your child, checking her growth against the standard growth charts. As part of the exam, your provider will check your little one's vision, listen to her heart and lungs, and assess motor skills and behavior, as well as reviewing how she's doing with sleeping and eating. Your child may also get booster vaccine doses as well as some first doses of certain vaccines, according to the latest immunization schedule.

  • If you’re looking for a new car seat, check out our list of the best toddler car seats as recommend by Pampers Parents. Go to the Parenting section and scroll down to Parents’ Picks to find our list of the top-voted products.

  • Check the rewards catalog to see which is your favorite. Plus, if you have a Pampers product nearby, scan the code now for points you can use to get your favorite reward.

  • If you haven't already, go to the "My Baby" section in your app profile and add your toddler's birthday. This gets you personalized parenting info that's just right for you and your toddler.

  • If you happen to have a Pampers product nearby, scan the code now to get great rewards like cash back, coupons, and gift cards!
content.translateValue:
• Coordonnez-vous avec votre partenaire sur la façon de communiquer. Il se peut que cela se soit déjà produit organiquement, mais maintenant que votre tout-petit comprend davantage ce que vous dites, vous pouvez vous mettre d’accord avec votre partenaire pour épeler certains mots de façon à ce que votre enfant de 14 mois ne puisse pas comprendre. Par exemple, « Est-ce qu’il est temps d’aller au P-A-R-C? » Vous pouvez également vous rappeler l’un à l’autre de faire attention à ce que vous dites en présence de votre tout-petit, afin d’éviter que son vocabulaire grandissant n’inclue accidentellement quelque chose d’un peu plus coloré que vous ne l’auriez voulu.

  • Prévoyez la première coupe de cheveux de votre enfant. Si les mèches de votre tout-petit deviennent assez longues, il est peut-être temps pour sa première coupe de cheveux! Bien sûr, certains enfants peuvent déjà en avoir eu une, tandis que pour d’autres, cela peut être encore loin.

  • Créez une liste d’idées de repas et un plan. À mesure que l’activité s’intensifie dans votre foyer, vous trouverez peut-être utile d’établir un plan de repas hebdomadaire. Ainsi, vous saurez exactement quoi acheter et vous ne vous demanderez pas quoi faire. Vous pouvez également conserver une liste de repas sains et populaires dans votre foyer. Ainsi, lorsque vous manquez d’inspiration, vous pouvez vous référer à ce qui a fonctionné dans le passé. Vous pouvez même prendre des photos des repas et les enregistrer sur votre téléphone afin de pouvoir les feuilleter rapidement lorsque vous êtes à la recherche d’idées.

  • Fixez la date de la visite de suivi de votre enfant dès l’âge de 15 mois. Lors de cette visite de suivi, le prestataire de soins de santé de votre tout-petit pèsera et mesurera votre enfant. Il vérifiera ainsi sa croissance par rapport aux courbes de croissance standard. Dans le cadre de cet examen, votre prestataire vérifiera la vision de votre tout-petit, écoutera son cœur et ses poumons, évaluera ses capacités motrices et son comportement, et s’intéressera à son sommeil et à son alimentation. Votre enfant peut également recevoir des doses de vaccin de rappel ainsi que les premières doses de certains vaccins, conformément au calendrier de vaccination le plus récent.

  • Si vous êtes à la recherche d’un nouveau siège de voiture, consultez notre liste des meilleurs sièges pour tout-petits, recommandés par les Parents Pampers. Accédez à la section Parenting et faites défiler jusqu’à Parents’ Picks pour trouver les produits que les Parents Pampers recommandent.

  • Consultez le catalogue des récompenses pour savoir lequel vous préférez. Si vous avez un produit Pampers à proximité, balayez le code maintenant pour ramasser des points que vous pouvez utiliser pour obtenir votre récompense préférée.

  • Si ce n’est pas déjà fait, accédez à la section « My Baby » de votre profil dans l’application et ajoutez la date de naissance de votre tout-petit. Cela vous permettra d’obtenir des renseignements personnalisés sur la parentalité qui sont parfaitement adaptés à vous et à votre tout-petit.

  • Si vous avez un produit Pampers à proximité, balayez le code maintenant pour obtenir de superbes récompenses comme des cadeaux, des bons rabais et des cartes-cadeaux!
